title: Revelation Chapter 22 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Revelation chapter 22 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Revelation Chapter 22 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Revelation Chapter 22.

questions.question: What flows out of the throne of God and of the Lamb according to Revelation 22:1?
options: A pure river of water of life
questions.correctAnswer: A pure river of water of life
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:1 describes a pure river of water of life, clear as crystal, proceeding out of the throne of God and of the Lamb.

questions.question: According to Revelation 22:2, what special tree is found on either side of the river?
questions.correctAnswer: The tree of life
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:2 mentions the tree of life which bears twelve manner of fruits and whose leaves are for the healing of the nations.

questions.question: What will there be no more of in the city as stated in Revelation 22:3?
questions.correctAnswer: Curse
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:3 says there shall be no more curse in the city because the throne of God and of the Lamb will be there.

questions.question: According to Revelation 22:4, what will the servants of God see?
questions.correctAnswer: His face
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:4 states that the servants shall see God's face and His name shall be in their foreheads.

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 22:5 says there will be night in the city.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:5 clearly states there shall be no night there and no need for candle or sun because the Lord God gives them light.

questions.question: Who sent his angel to show the things which must shortly be done, according to Revelation 22:6?
options: The Lord God of the holy prophets
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord God of the holy prophets
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:6 states that the Lord God of the holy prophets sent his angel to show his servants the things which must shortly be done.

questions.question: According to Revelation 22:7, who is blessed?
options: He that keepeth the sayings of the prophecy of this book
questions.correctAnswer: He that keepeth the sayings of the prophecy of this book
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:7 says blessed is he that keepeth the sayings of the prophecy of this book.

questions.question: What did John do when he saw and heard the things in Revelation 22:8?
options: Fell down to worship the angel
questions.correctAnswer: Fell down to worship the angel
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:8 tells us that John fell down to worship before the feet of the angel after seeing and hearing the things.

questions.question: What did the angel tell John not to do in Revelation 22:9?
options: Do not worship me, worship God
questions.correctAnswer: Do not worship me, worship God
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:9 records that the angel told John not to worship him but to worship God, as he is a fellow servant.

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 22:10 instructs to seal the words of the prophecy of this book.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:10 instructs not to seal the sayings of the prophecy of this book because the time is at hand.

questions.question: According to Revelation 22:12, what will Jesus bring when He comes quickly?
options: His reward to give every man according as his work shall be
questions.correctAnswer: His reward to give every man according as his work shall be
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:12 states that Jesus comes quickly and brings his reward to give to every man according to his works.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Revelation 22:13: 'I am Alpha and Omega, the ______ and the end, the first and the last.'
questions.correctAnswer: beginning
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:13 says Jesus is Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end, the first and the last.

questions.question: Who are excluded from the city as per Revelation 22:15?
options: Dogs, sorcerers, whoremongers, murderers, idolaters, and liars
questions.correctAnswer: Dogs, sorcerers, whoremongers, murderers, idolaters, and liars
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:15 lists those who are outside the city including dogs, sorcerers, whoremongers, murderers, idolaters, and those who love and make a lie.

questions.question: According to Revelation 22:16, Jesus is described as what?
options: The root and the offspring of David, and the bright and morning star
questions.correctAnswer: The root and the offspring of David, and the bright and morning star
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:16 describes Jesus as the root and the offspring of David, and the bright and morning star.

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 22:17 invites anyone who is thirsty to take the water of life freely.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:17 invites whosoever is athirst to come and take the water of life freely.

medium.title: Revelation Chapter 22 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Revelation Chapter 22 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with temptation and inconsistency in their spiritual walk. Based on Revelation 22, what biblical truth would you share about persevering in righteousness?
options: He that is righteous, let him be righteous still
God will forgive all sins without repentance
One should keep changing their beliefs frequently
Righteousness is not important in the last days
questions.correctAnswer: He that is righteous, let him be righteous still
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:11 emphasizes the importance of perseverance in righteousness, encouraging believers to remain steadfast in their holy walk. This is supported by the call to keep the sayings of the prophecy (22:7) and the promise of reward according to one's works (22:12).

questions.question: How does Revelation 22 teach us about the importance of obedience to God's commandments in relation to eternal blessings?
options: Blessed are they that do his commandments, that they may have right to the tree of life
Blessed are those who ignore commandments to live freely
Commandments are only suggestions for believers
Doing commandments does not affect eternal life
questions.correctAnswer: Blessed are they that do his commandments, that they may have right to the tree of life
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:14 clearly states that obedience to God's commandments grants access to the tree of life and entry into the holy city. This is linked to the overall theme of blessing those who keep the prophecy (22:7) and the promise of reigning forever (22:5).

questions.question: A believer feels discouraged about sharing their faith. According to Revelation 22, what encouragement can you give about evangelism and inviting others?
options: Let him that is athirst come, and whosoever will, let him take the water of life freely
Faith is private and should not be shared
Only priests can invite others to salvation
Evangelism is optional and not urgent
questions.correctAnswer: Let him that is athirst come, and whosoever will, let him take the water of life freely
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:17 invites all who hear and thirst to come and freely take the water of life, highlighting the open call to evangelize and share the gospel generously. This is supported by the angel sent by Jesus to testify (22:16) and the urgency of the prophecy (22:6, 22:7).

questions.question: What does Revelation 22 teach about trusting God's timing and the assurance of Jesus' return?
options: Behold, I come quickly; blessed is he that keepeth the sayings of the prophecy
Jesus will delay His return indefinitely
We should set specific dates for Jesus' coming
The timing of Jesus' return is unknown and unimportant
questions.correctAnswer: Behold, I come quickly; blessed is he that keepeth the sayings of the prophecy
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:7 and 22:20 affirm the certainty and imminence of Jesus' return, encouraging believers to remain faithful and obedient. This teaches trust in God's timing and the importance of readiness.

questions.question: How does the vision of the river of water of life and the tree of life in Revelation 22 encourage believers in their daily spiritual disciplines?
options: The river of water of life proceeding from the throne symbolizes continual spiritual nourishment
Spiritual disciplines are unnecessary in the new heaven and earth
The tree of life is only symbolic and has no practical meaning
The river and tree are reminders to focus on material blessings
questions.correctAnswer: The river of water of life proceeding from the throne symbolizes continual spiritual nourishment
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:1-2 describe the pure river and the tree of life yielding fruit monthly, symbolizing ongoing spiritual sustenance and healing, encouraging believers to seek daily nourishment through prayer and obedience.

questions.question: A believer complains about the darkness in their life circumstances. Based on Revelation 22, what hope does the chapter offer about God's provision of light?
options: There shall be no night there; the Lord God giveth them light
Believers must provide their own light during trials
Darkness is inevitable and God does not intervene
Candles and sun provide necessary light for believers
questions.correctAnswer: There shall be no night there; the Lord God giveth them light
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:5 teaches that in God's presence there is no night or need for artificial light because God Himself is the eternal light, promising believers enduring hope and illumination in all circumstances.

questions.question: What does Revelation 22 reveal about the relationship between God's servants and Him in the eternal state, encouraging believers to serve faithfully?
options: His servants shall serve him and see His face
Serving God will cease in the eternal state
Only angels serve God, not believers
Serving God is a burden to be avoided
questions.correctAnswer: His servants shall serve him and see His face
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:3-4 affirm that God's servants will serve Him and have intimate fellowship, seeing His face, which encourages believers to serve God faithfully now with the promise of eternal communion.

questions.question: How does Revelation 22 instruct believers about humility and worship in response to divine revelation?
options: It is appropriate to worship angels who bring messages
Worship should be directed to any spiritual being
Humility is not necessary when receiving visions
questions.correctAnswer: Worship God alone, not angels
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:8-9 shows John attempting to worship the angel, but the angel redirects worship to God alone, teaching humility and reverence for God as the sole object of worship.

questions.question: A believer wonders if modifying or adding to the Bible is acceptable. What does Revelation 22 teach about this concern?
options: If any man shall add unto these things, God shall add unto him the plagues written in this book
Adding to the Bible is encouraged for clarity
The Bible is open to personal interpretation and changes
Removing parts of the prophecy is permitted
questions.correctAnswer: If any man shall add unto these things, God shall add unto him the plagues written in this book
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:18-19 warn strongly against adding to or taking away from the words of the prophecy, underscoring the importance of preserving Scripture's integrity and obedience to God's revealed word.

questions.question: What assurance does Revelation 22 provide about God's reward and justice that helps believers maintain integrity at work and in daily life?
options: My reward is with me, to give every man according as his work shall be
Justice will only be served in this life
God overlooks daily work and conduct
Rewards are based on popularity, not works
questions.correctAnswer: My reward is with me, to give every man according as his work shall be
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:12 declares that Jesus brings rewards according to each person's works, encouraging believers to live with honesty and integrity in all areas of life.

questions.question: A Christian parent wants to teach their children about the importance of spiritual healing and restoration. How can Revelation 22's description of the tree of life inform this teaching?
options: The leaves of the tree were for the healing of the nations
The tree only produces fruit once a year
The tree is a symbol of earthly wealth
Healing is only physical and not spiritual
questions.correctAnswer: The leaves of the tree were for the healing of the nations
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:2 describes the tree of life bearing fruit monthly and its leaves providing healing, symbolizing God's provision for spiritual and holistic restoration, which is vital to teach children about God's care.

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 22 teaches that the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ is extended to all believers as a final blessing.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:21 offers a closing benediction extending the grace of Jesus to all readers, affirming the continual presence of grace in the Christian life.

questions.question: True or False: According to Revelation 22, God’s servants will need candles or sunlight to see His face in the new heaven and earth.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:5 states there will be no night, no need for candles or sun, because the Lord God Himself is the light, ensuring His servants see His face clearly without other light sources.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Revelation 22:13 says, "I am Alpha and Omega, the ______ and the end, the first and the last."
questions.correctAnswer: beginning
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:13 identifies Jesus as "the beginning and the end," emphasizing His eternal nature and sovereignty, which encourages believers to trust fully in Him.

questions.question: Based on Revelation 22, what should a believer do when they hear the words of this prophecy?
options: Keep the sayings of the prophecy of this book
Seal the prophecy and reveal it later
questions.correctAnswer: Keep the sayings of the prophecy of this book
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:7 instructs believers to keep the sayings of the prophecy, highlighting the importance of obedience and faithfulness to God's revealed word for blessing and readiness.

hard.title: Revelation Chapter 22 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Revelation Chapter 22.

questions.question: What is the source of the 'pure river of water of life' described in Revelation 22?
options: The throne of God and of the Lamb
questions.correctAnswer: The throne of God and of the Lamb
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:1 states that the river of water of life proceeds out of the throne of God and of the Lamb, symbolizing divine origin and eternal life.

questions.question: The tree of life in Revelation 22:2 bears how many kinds of fruit?
questions.correctAnswer: Twelve manner of fruits
questions.explanation: The text in Revelation 22:2 mentions the tree of life bearing twelve manner of fruits, which may symbolize completeness and connection to the twelve tribes of Israel.

questions.question: According to Revelation 22:4, what will the servants of God see and have on their foreheads?
options: They shall see His face, and His name shall be on their foreheads
They shall see the Lamb, and His mark shall be on their hands
They shall see the angels, and His seal shall be on their hearts
They shall see the city, and His covenant shall be on their tongues
questions.correctAnswer: They shall see His face, and His name shall be on their foreheads
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:4 indicates that the redeemed will see God's face directly and His name will be written on their foreheads, symbolizing intimate fellowship and ownership.

questions.question: In Revelation 22:5, what is said about night and light in the new city?
options: There shall be no night, and the Lord God gives them light
Night will be as bright as day
questions.correctAnswer: There shall be no night, and the Lord God gives them light
questions.explanation: The verse reveals a setting where divine presence replaces natural light sources, showing God's eternal illumination and reign.

questions.question: Who sent the angel to show the servants the things that must shortly be done, according to Revelation 22:6?
options: The Lord God of the holy prophets
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord God of the holy prophets
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:6 attributes the sending of the angel to the Lord God of the holy prophets, emphasizing divine authority and prophetic continuity.

questions.question: What is the significance of the repeated phrase 'I come quickly' in Revelation 22?
options: It emphasizes the imminent return of Jesus
It refers to the swift judgement of angels
It describes the rapid writing of prophecy
It relates to the quick destruction of the earth
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes the imminent return of Jesus
questions.explanation: The phrase 'I come quickly' (Revelation 22:7, 12, 20) underscores the nearness of Christ's return and the urgency for readiness among believers.

questions.question: In Revelation 22:9, what command does the angel give to John regarding worship?
options: Worship the angel as a messenger
questions.correctAnswer: Worship God, not the angel
questions.explanation: The angel in verse 9 instructs John not to worship him because he is a fellow servant, but to worship God alone, reflecting early Christian monotheism and prohibition of angel worship.

questions.question: What instruction does Revelation 22:10 give about the prophecy of this book?
options: Seal not the sayings of the prophecy
Seal the prophecy until the end of time
Only reveal the prophecy to the priests
questions.correctAnswer: Seal not the sayings of the prophecy
questions.explanation: The verse commands that the prophecy should not be sealed because the time is near, indicating that the revelation is for immediate application and awareness.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'He that is unjust, let him be unjust still; and he which is filthy, let him be filthy still; and he that is righteous, let him be righteous still; and he that is ____ , let him be holy still.'
questions.correctAnswer: holy
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:11 uses parallelism to affirm the finality of moral states, concluding with 'holy' to complete the fourfold contrast.

questions.question: Who is described as 'the Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end, the first and the last' in Revelation 22:13?
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: This title in verse 13 is a Christological self-identification, emphasizing Jesus' divine eternal nature consistent with Old Testament Yahweh declarations.

questions.question: According to Revelation 22:14, who are blessed in relation to the tree of life?
questions.correctAnswer: They that do his commandments
questions.explanation: The verse links obedience to God's commandments with right to the tree of life and entrance into the city, reflecting covenantal blessings.

questions.question: Who are excluded from the holy city as listed in Revelation 22:15?
options: Dogs, sorcerers, whoremongers, murderers, idolaters, and liars
Tax collectors, Pharisees, Gentiles, and sinners
questions.correctAnswer: Dogs, sorcerers, whoremongers, murderers, idolaters, and liars
questions.explanation: Verse 15 lists these groups to depict moral impurity and unrepentance that bar entry into the holy city, underscoring holiness required for eternal fellowship.

questions.question: In Revelation 22:16, Jesus describes Himself as the root and offspring of whom?
questions.correctAnswer: David
questions.explanation: Jesus' identification as root and offspring of David links Messianic fulfillment of Old Testament prophecy to His royal lineage (2 Samuel 7).

questions.question: What invitation is extended to 'whosoever will' in Revelation 22:17?
options: Let him take the water of life freely
Let him enter the holy city
Let him receive the seal of God
questions.correctAnswer: Let him take the water of life freely
questions.explanation: The verse offers an open invitation to partake of the water of life, symbolizing eternal salvation and grace freely given to all.

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 22:18 warns that adding to the words of the prophecy will result in God adding plagues written in this book.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 18 explicitly warns against adding to the prophecy, threatening divine plagues as a consequence, emphasizing the sacred integrity of the revelation.

theological.title: Revelation Chapter 22 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Revelation Chapter 22 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What flows from the throne of God and of the Lamb as described in Revelation 22?
options: A pure river of water of life, clear as crystal
A river of fire and brimstone
A river of wine and milk
questions.correctAnswer: A pure river of water of life, clear as crystal
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:1 describes a pure river of water of life, clear as crystal, proceeding from the throne of God and of the Lamb. This imagery corresponds with Old Testament themes such as the river flowing from Eden (Ezekiel 47:1-12) and the living water promised by Jesus (John 4:14; John 7:38).

questions.question: According to Revelation 22, what is the purpose of the leaves of the tree of life?
options: For the healing of the nations
To give shade to the servants of God
questions.correctAnswer: For the healing of the nations
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:2 explicitly states the leaves of the tree of life are for the healing of the nations. This reflects the restoration and peace themes found in Isaiah 11:6-9 and Ezekiel 47:12, where God's kingdom brings healing and reconciliation to all peoples.

questions.question: What is said about the curse in the new heaven and new earth described in Revelation 22?
options: There shall be no more curse
The curse shall remain but be lessened
The curse is transferred to the sea
The curse will be renewed on the earth
questions.correctAnswer: There shall be no more curse
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:3 states that there shall be no more curse, indicating the full removal of sin's penalty in the eschaton. This fulfills promises like those in Galatians 3:13-14 and the new creation prophecies in Isaiah 65:17 and 2 Corinthians 5:17.

questions.question: Who shall be in the city and serve God according to Revelation 22?
questions.correctAnswer: His servants
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:3 says the throne of God and the Lamb will be in the city and His servants shall serve Him. This echoes Old Testament anticipations of God's servants worshipping Him (Isaiah 61:6) and the New Testament's depiction of the redeemed serving God (Revelation 7:15).

questions.question: What is the significance of seeing God's face in the new creation as mentioned in Revelation 22?
options: They shall see God as a burning fire
They shall only know God through angels
They shall see God only in dreams
questions.correctAnswer: They shall see his face
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:4 states that the redeemed shall see God's face, symbolizing direct fellowship and intimacy with God, which contrasts with Old Testament limitations (Exodus 33:20). This fulfillment aligns with promises in 1 Corinthians 13:12 and John 17:24.

questions.question: In Revelation 22, what provides light if there is no night?
options: The Lord God giveth them light
The moon and stars shine brightly
A great angel holds a flaming sword
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord God giveth them light
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:5 teaches that there shall be no night, and no need for sun or candle because the Lord God Himself provides the light. This recalls the divine presence as light seen in Isaiah 60:19-20 and God's glory illuminating the new Jerusalem (Ezekiel 43:2).

questions.question: Who sent the angel to show the servants the things which must shortly be done?
options: The Lord God of the holy prophets
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord God of the holy prophets
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:6 reveals that the Lord God of the holy prophets sent His angel to reveal imminent events. This underlines God’s sovereign control and continuity of prophetic revelation from Old Testament prophets (Amos 3:7; Malachi 3:1).

questions.question: What blessing is pronounced on those who keep the sayings of the prophecy of this book?
options: Blessed is he that keepeth the sayings of the prophecy of this book
Blessed is he that ignores the prophecy
Blessed are the wealthy who buy the book
Blessed are those who preach only from the Old Testament
questions.correctAnswer: Blessed is he that keepeth the sayings of the prophecy of this book
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:7 pronounces blessing on those who obey the prophecy's teachings, emphasizing faithfulness to God’s final revelation. This is consistent with Deuteronomy 28:1-2 and James 1:25 about obedience and blessing.

questions.question: What command does the angel give John when he tries to worship him?
options: See thou do it not: worship God
Worship me as I am an angel of God
Bow down to the throne instead
questions.correctAnswer: See thou do it not: worship God
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:9 instructs John not to worship the angel but to worship God alone, affirming the monotheistic worship proper to God (Exodus 20:3; Matthew 4:10). Angels are fellow servants, not objects of worship.

questions.question: What does the angel say about sealing the sayings of the prophecy of this book?
options: Seal not the sayings of the prophecy of this book
Seal the prophecy until the end of the age
Seal it with seven seals immediately
questions.correctAnswer: Seal not the sayings of the prophecy of this book
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:10 commands not to seal the prophecy because the time is near. This contrasts with Daniel 12:4 and 9 where sealing was required until the end times, indicating immediacy of the revelation.

questions.question: How does Revelation 22 describe the coming of Jesus and His reward?
options: I come quickly; and my reward is with me, to give every man according as his work shall be
I come slowly; with no reward
I come in secret; to judge only the nations
I come with angels to destroy the earth
questions.correctAnswer: I come quickly; and my reward is with me, to give every man according as his work shall be
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:12 affirms the imminent return of Christ with reward according to works. This is consistent with Matthew 16:27, 2 Corinthians 5:10, and Romans 2:6-7 regarding divine judgment and reward.

questions.question: How does Jesus identify Himself in Revelation 22?
options: Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end, the first and the last
questions.correctAnswer: Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end, the first and the last
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:13 identifies Jesus as the Alpha and Omega, affirming His eternal nature and deity, consistent with Isaiah 44:6, Isaiah 48:12, and John 1:1-3.

questions.question: Who are excluded from entering the holy city according to Revelation 22?
options: Dogs, sorcerers, whoremongers, murderers, idolaters, and liars
questions.correctAnswer: Dogs, sorcerers, whoremongers, murderers, idolaters, and liars
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:15 lists those excluded from the city, emphasizing holiness and righteousness as prerequisites, paralleling similar exclusions in Exodus 22:31 and 1 Corinthians 6:9-10.

questions.question: What titles does Jesus use for Himself in Revelation 22?
options: Root and offspring of David, bright and morning star
King of Israel, Son of Abraham
questions.correctAnswer: Root and offspring of David, bright and morning star
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:16 shows Jesus identifying as the root and offspring of David, fulfilling messianic prophecy (Isaiah 11:1; Jeremiah 23:5) and as the bright morning star (2 Peter 1:19; Numbers 24:17).

questions.question: What invitation is extended to those who are thirsty in Revelation 22?
options: Let him take the water of life freely
questions.correctAnswer: Let him take the water of life freely
questions.explanation: Revelation 22:17 invites all who thirst to freely take the water of life, echoing Jesus’ promise in John 7:37-39 and Isaiah 55:1, symbolizing the free gift of salvation and the Holy Spirit.
